availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Christopher Chinn (Mercer County, KY, judge, coroner, and farmer)

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, judge, coroner, and farmer. Kentucky native. Married Sarah W. S. Hardin Chinn in Washington County, Kentucky on May 12, 1811. Father of Jane Tandy Chinn, John Chinn, Mary Ellen Chinn, Christopher P. Chinn, and Jack Chinn. Trustee of the Methodist Episcopal Church in Harrodsburg, Kentucky. Coroner in Mercer County in 1847. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Judge of the Mercer County Court in Harrodsburg in 1860. Owned nine enslaved people in Harrodsburg in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 689.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 46B.

_Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Washington County Marriages, 1792-1930, Film #000241382, p. 331.
Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky Passed at the December Session, 1841 (Frankfort, KY: A. G. Hodges & Co., State Printer, 1842), 174.
Taliaferro P. Shaffner, ed., _ The Kentucky State Register, for the Year 1847_ (Louisville: Morton & Griswold, 1847), 133.
